alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Pike; Posey; Spencer; Vanderburgh; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued March 04 at 5:42AM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Renewed Flooding of Rivers and Poor Drainage Areas Is Possible Sunday night Into Monday... Numerous showers and a few thunderstorms will develop Saturday night and Sunday. However, the heaviest and most widespread rainfall is expected Sunday night and Monday morning. The ground is still moist from a very wet February, and several rivers are still above flood stage. At least an inch of rain is expected Sunday night, with more on Monday. The heavy rainfall could prolong ongoing flooding on the mainstem rivers, and renewed flooding could develop on the smaller rivers. There is also the potential for some flooding of poor drainage and flood prone areas. Thunderstorm activity could result in isolated very heavy rainfall rates. This hydrologic outlook serves to give advance notice of the potential of heavy rainfall that could produce some flooding impacts. Monitor later forecasts and outlooks if you live in a flood prone area.

area.areaDesc: Gibson; Pike; Posey; Spencer; Vanderburgh; Warrick
